DataElement.preferredName: International Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma Database Consortium Criteria Assessment Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The risk category related to an assessment of international metastatic renal cell carcinoma database consortium (IMDC) criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: International Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma Database Consortium Criteria Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A validated risk prediction tool for patients with metastatic renal cell carcinoma (mRCC) receiving first-line targeted therapy. The model considers: Karnofsky performance status less than 80%, time from diagnosis to first-line targeted therapy less than 1 year, hemoglobin concentration less than lower limit of normal, neutrophil count greater than upper limit of normal, platelet count greater than upper limit of normal, and serum calcium concentration greater than upper limit of normal._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredName: International Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma Database Consortium Criteria
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A validated risk prediction tool for patients with metastatic renal cell carcinoma (mRCC) receiving first-line targeted therapy. The model considers: Karnofsky performance status less than 80%, time from diagnosis to first-line targeted therapy less than 1 year, hemoglobin concentration less than lower limit of normal, neutrophil count greater than upper limit of normal, platelet count greater than upper limit of normal, and serum calcium concentration greater than upper limit of normal.

Concepts.longName: International Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma Database Consortium Criteria
Concepts.definition: A validated risk prediction tool for patients with metastatic renal cell carcinoma (mRCC) receiving first-line targeted therapy. The model considers: Karnofsky performance status less than 80%, time from diagnosis to first-line targeted therapy less than 1 year, hemoglobin concentration less than lower limit of normal, neutrophil count greater than upper limit of normal, platelet count greater than upper limit of normal, and serum calcium concentration greater than upper limit of normal.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
